Sub:- Information to appropriate authority about the involvement  of Airport  
            Entry  Pass  (AEP) holders in criminal cases. 
 
 
Instructions were issued vide BCAS letter No. 9(29)/96-DIV-VII dated 11-03-
1996 (copy enclosed) to keep the BCAS informed about the involvement of Airport Entry 
Pass Holders in criminal cases and  to ensure that those who are convicted in a criminal 
offence do not  gain  access to the restricted areas of the Airport and their passes are 
withdrawn. 
 
2. 
It has been observed that the above instructions are not being followed in some 
cases.  In order to ensure strict implementation of the above guidelines, the following 
instructions shall be followed with immediate effect: - 
 
(i) 
It shall be the responsibility of each agency to keep the concerned 
RDCOS, BCAS informed at the earliest opportunity about the arrest or 
involvement of any of their employee in a criminal case. 
 
(ii) 
Upon conviction or acquittal of such AEP Holder in the criminal case 
from any court of law, the same shall be intimated to the RDCOS 
concerned. 
 
(iii) 
RDCOS, BCAS shall refer such cases to the   AEP Committee at first 
opportunity for taking a decision to cancel the pass of such convicted AEP 
Holder. 
 
(iv) 
RDCOS, BCAS shall inform the agency concerned about the cancellation 
of such pass of the effected employee so that same is withdrawn from the 
employee concerned and deposited to the concerned RDCOS office for 
further necessary action. 
 
(v) 
Proper record of the above cases shall be maintained by the BCAS and 
agency concerned so that these persons do not obtain Airport Entry Passes 
through some other agency after gaining employment elsewhere.
2:
:2: 
 
(vi) 
It shall be ensured by the AEP Committee that the employees of any 
agency who are convicted in criminal cases are not issued with AEP 
(temporary / regular).    At the time of renewal, it shall be ensured by the 
AEP Committee that the AEP is not renewed for a convicted person   
 
(vii) 
Any violation of the above guidelines shall be viewed seriously.
